project.name: autodocs
project.description: Automates publishing docuentation for NodeJs projects, for use continuous integration and continuous deployment

AutodocsRun.name: AutodocsRun
AutodocsRun.description:
The main entry point for being invoked from npm scripts
(or even from the command line)

Simply does `autodocs.run()`

classitems.description:
Initialisation step for Travis

Used to check/ set any Travis environment variables
classitems.name: init

classitems.description: Used to set value of `REPO_SLUG`
classitems.name: TRAVIS_REPO_SLUG

classitems.description:
The repository to publish documentation to.
Override if you wish to publish to a different repository.
classitems.name: REPO_SLUG

classitems.description: Whether this is a pull request.
classitems.name: TRAVIS_PULL_REQUEST

classitems.description: The name of the current branch
classitems.name: TRAVIS_BRANCH

classitems.description: The build number, e.g. `74`
classitems.name: TRAVIS_BUILD_NUMBER

classitems.description: The job number, e.g. `74.1`
classitems.name: TRAVIS_JOB_NUMBER

classitems.description:
Based on the Travis environment variables,
determines whether to trigger generation and publishing of documentation.

If `FLAG_PUBLISH_ON_RELEASE` is `true`,
then will trigger if Travis says that a tag was pushed.

Otherwise, it will trigger when a branch is pushed,
if Travis says that this **is not** a pull request,
and the branch being pushed matches `DOCUMENT_BRANCH`.

Both cases also require that the correct build index for the current job
matches `DOCUMENT_JOB_INDEX`.
This is to ensure that documentation is only published once per successful build.
classitems.name: shouldRun

return.description: `true` when documentation should be generated and published

classitems.description: When all operations are complete, this is invoked
classitems.name: allComplete

classitems.description:
Outputs the base URL and the API URL at which the documentation should be published.

Uses `CNAME` file based on best guess,
otherwise defaults to `*.github/*`
classitems.name: outputUrls

classitems.description:
Utility function to execute a file on the commandline
via a separate process (child process)

params.name: args
params.description: arguments to pass to the executable

return.description:
Rejects if the command failed,
                   otherwise resolves with stdout and stdin

classitems.description:
Utility function to execute a statement on the commandline
via a separate process (child process)

return.description:
Rejects if the command failed,
                   otherwise resolves with stdout and stdin

classitems.description:
Initialisation step for Github Pages

Used to check/ set any Github Pages environment variables
classitems.name: init

classitems.description:
- Must be set, use an encrypted token
  - If using the ruby gem:
    `travis encrypt GH_TOKEN=GITHUB_ACCESS_TOKEN --add`
  - If using the npm module:
    `travis-encrypt -r GH_USER/GH_REPO GH_TOKEN=GITHUB_ACCESS_TOKEN`
    and then copy into `.travis.yml`
- This is used to give Travis write access to your Git repository,
  and will be used to push to the `gh-pages` branch
classitems.name: GH_TOKEN

classitems.description:
All documentation will be published under to this branch.

For most repositories, the default `gh-pages` will do.
However, for user or organisation pages, `master` could also be appropriate
classitems.name: GH_PUBLISH_BRANCH

classitems.description: Github user or organisation name
classitems.name: GH_USER

classitems.description: Github repository name
classitems.name: GH_REPO

classitems.description:
Performs the required steps for publishing to Github pages

- runs `npm run generatedocs`
- `git fetch`es the `gh-pages` branch of the project into a throwaway git repository
- copies the documentation generated by the `generatedocs` script into the `gh-pages` branch
- copies any additional files required into the gh-pages branch
- if any files have changed, `git commit`s `git push`es on the `gh-pages` branch
  - this is when the files actually succeed in publishing
- if necessary, cleans up the throwaway git repository
classitems.name: run

classitems.description:
Invokes the `generatedocs` command,
unless `FLAG_SKIP_GENERATE` is true,
in which case it assume that the docs
have already been generated.
classitems.name: runGeneratedocs

classitems.description:
Invokes the `testdocs` command,
unless `FLAG_SKIP_TEST` is true,
in which case it is up to the client
to invoke tests as appropriate.
classitems.name: runTestdocs

classitems.description: Set up the git respository used to publish to github pages
classitems.name: setUpRepo

classitems.description:
Set up remaining environment variables required
for publishing to github pages
classitems.name: setUpVars

classitems.description:
Will determine which continuous integration environment and publishing environment to use,
and then run those appropriately.

Currently, the supported ones are:

- Continuous Integration (`SELECT_CI`):
  - `travis`
- Publishing Environment (`SELECT_PUBLISH`):
  - `github-pages`

Runs various environment variables checks and sets defaults where appropriate.
Then tests whether this particular build should trigger publishing the documentation,
and if so fires the publish script
classitems.name: run

classitems.description:
Initialisation step for Autodocs

Used to check/ set any Autodocs environment variables
classitems.name: init

classitems.description: The directory that the project being published ios located in.
classitems.name: PROJECT_DIR

classitems.description:
The major version of the project.

`1.2.3` --> `1`
classitems.name: MAJOR_VERSION
classitems.default: The major version read in from package.json

classitems.description:
The minor version of the project

`1.2.3` --> `2`
classitems.name: MINOR_VERSION
classitems.default: The minor version read in from package.json

classitems.description:
The patch version of the project

`1.2.3` --> `3`
classitems.name: PATCH_VERSION
classitems.default: The patch version read in from package.json

classitems.description: Name to use when creating the Git commit
classitems.name: GIT_USER

classitems.description: Email address to use when creating the Git commit
classitems.name: GIT_EMAIL

classitems.description:
Whether there are any assets to copy.
Set to `true` **only if** intending to use `DOCUMENT_ASSETS`.
classitems.name: FLAG_COPY_ASSETS

classitems.description:
By default, publish will occur when a branch is pushed.

When this flag is set to `true`,
publish will occur when a tag is pushed instead.
classitems.name: FLAG_PUBLISH_ON_RELEASE

classitems.description: Whether to clean up afterward, by deleting the directory that was published
classitems.name: FLAG_CLEAN_DOCUMENT

classitems.description:
Any tokens contained in the build output will be stripped out
before being printed.
This is to ensure security,
especially if your CI's build logs are publicly available
classitems.name: FLAG_STRIP_TOKEN_OUTPUT

classitems.description:
By default, this will publish a latest page,
whose purpose is simply to redirect to the most recently publish API version

Assuming default values for other configurations,
if the version of the project is currently `1.2.3`,

- `http://USER.github.io/REPO/api/latest/`
- This URL will be published with an `index.html` file that redirects to:
- `http://USER.github.io/REPO/api/1.2/`

Set to `false` to disable this behaviour.
classitems.name: FLAG_LATEST_PAGE

classitems.description:
By default, this will publish an all page,
whose purpose is simply to list and link to all published API versions

Assuming default values for other configurations,
if the versions of the project are currently `0.1`, `0.2`, `0.3`, and `1.0`

- `http://USER.github.io/REPO/api/all/`
- This URL will be published with an `index.html` file that links to:
  - `http://USER.github.io/REPO/api/0.1/`
  - `http://USER.github.io/REPO/api/0.2/`
  - `http://USER.github.io/REPO/api/0.3/`
  - `http://USER.github.io/REPO/api/1.0/`

Set to `false` to disable this behaviour.
classitems.name: FLAG_ALL_PAGE

classitems.description:
Set to false to do all of the steps in publishing,
except for the final step of pushing the changes to the git remote.

This is useful for testing and debugging purposes.
Leaving this on in a CI environment would defeat the purpose of autodocs
classitems.name: FLAG_SKIP_PUSH

classitems.description:
Set to true to skip step where documentation is generated. i.e. Do not run

`npm run generatedocs`

This is useful for testing and debugging purposes.
Leaving this on in a CI environment would defeat the purpose of autodocs
classitems.name: FLAG_SKIP_GENERATE

classitems.description:
Set to true to skip step where documentation is tested.
i.e. Do not run tests

`npm run testdocs`

This is useful when the generate command executes
its own tests
classitems.name: FLAG_SKIP_TEST

classitems.description:
Set to true to skips the entirety of the CI publish run function.
**None** of the publishing related step will occur,
except for setting any required environment variables.

This is useful for testing and debugging purposes.
Leaving this on in a CI environment would defeat the purpose of autodocs
classitems.name: FLAG_SKIP_PUBLISH_RUN

classitems.description: Documentation will be generated only when this **branch** is pushed
classitems.name: DOCUMENT_BRANCH

classitems.description:
Documentation will be generated only on one of the jobs
for each build, use this to specify which one.
classitems.name: DOCUMENT_JOB_INDEX

classitems.description:
The name of the npm script to run,
expecting the documentation to get generated.
For example:

`npm run ${DOCUMENT_GENERATE_HOOK}`
classitems.name: DOCUMENT_GENERATE_HOOK

classitems.description:
The name of the npm script to run,
expecting the documentation to get tested.
For example:

`npm run ${DOCUMENT_TEST_HOOK}`
classitems.name: DOCUMENT_TEST_HOOK

classitems.description:
After the documentation generation script is run,
autodocs expects to find its output in this folder.
The files located here will get published.
classitems.name: DOCUMENT_GENERATED_FOLDER

classitems.description:
All documentation will be published under this root directory

This can be used for **non-version-specific** documentation
classitems.name: DOCUMENT_PUBLISH_FOLDER_ROOT

classitems.description:
The documentation will be published in this subdirectory of the root directory.

This can be used for **version-specific** documentation
classitems.name: DOCUMENT_PUBLISH_SUBFOLDER

classitems.description:
If set to `'true'` `DOCUMENT_PUBLISH_FOLDER` is ignored,
and the document is published in the root folder instead.

If using this module to publish something like a blog,
instead of versioned software documentation,
you should set this flag to `true`.
classitems.name: FLAG_PUBLISH_IN_ROOT

classitems.description:
Joins `DOCUMENT_PUBLISH_FOLDER_ROOT` with `DOCUMENT_PUBLISH_SUBFOLDER`
to get a concrete path to publish the documentation.
classitems.name: DOCUMENT_PUBLISH_FOLDER

classitems.description:
list of files and folders (bash style) to copy into the root of the `gh-pages` branch
these files will be copied to the **root**, not the `DOCUMENT_PUBLISH_FOLDER`
classitems.name: DOCUMENT_ASSETS

classitems.description: Test that an environment variable exists
classitems.name: exists

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the environment variable

return.description: `true` when environment variable is defined and **is not** an empty string

classitems.description: Enforce that an environment variable exists
classitems.name: require

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the environment variable

throws.description: Throws and error when the environment variable does not exist

classitems.description: Set a default value for an environment variable if it does not exist
classitems.name: default

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the environment variable

return.description: The value of the existing or newly set environment variable

classitems.description:
Substitute the value of other environment variables into the named one.

For example:

```javascript
vars.MAJOR_VERSION = "0";
vars.MINOR_VERSION = "3";
EnvironmentVariables.substitute('api/{{MAJOR_VERSION}}.{{MINOR_VERSION}}');
```

... will return `'api/0.3'`;

Note that if this is done for multiple environment variables,
the order in which they are done will affect the result.
It is the responsibility of the caller to this function to ensure that
the values to be substituted in are already fully resolved:
this function **is not** recursive.
Therefore, cycles are also not allowed.
Any of these will result in indeterminate results, including errors.
classitems.name: default

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the environment variable

return.description: The value of the existing or newly set environment variable

classitems.description: Set a default value for an environment variable if it does not exist
classitems.name: selected

params.name: name
params.description: The names of the environment variables we want

return.description: A hash of key value pairs

classitems.description:
In a bash shell, when `printenv` is invoked,
parse its output into a Javascript object
classitems.name: parsePrintenv

params.name: out
params.description: If this is given, the values from `printenv` will be added/ overriden ob this object

return.description: A hash of key value pairs
